techmeme.title: Chinese shopping app Temu was the year's most downloaded free app in the US, for the second year in a row, followed by Threads, TikTok, ChatGPT, and then Google (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
YouTube adds a tool to let creators give authorization to several third parties, including Amazon, Apple, Nvidia, OpenAI, and Meta, to train on their videos (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
OpenAI makes ChatGPT Search available to all logged in users, not just subscribers, and says ChatGPT Search can be set as their browser's default search engine (Rachel Metz/Bloomberg)
Meta rolls out live AI, live translations, and Shazam to Ray-Ban smart glasses for members of its Early Access Program (Victoria Song/The Verge)
DeepMind unveils Veo 2, a next-gen video-generating AI model that can create 2+ minute long clips in resolutions up to 4K, behind a waitlist as part of VideoFX (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
